reviewText: The cable is about 1/2 thickness of Kensington's.  It may not provide the same cut resistance.  However, the thin cable is very manageable than thick, stiff cable.The 3.5ft length limits the distance to a stationary object under a desk to wrap the cable around.  I drove a large screw at the eye of the cable because the cable was short to wrap around.  The screw may be able to be unscrewed by theft, but it is good enough to deter potential theft in my office.  I recommend anything over 5ft cable to effectively wrap around desk leg or a secure hasp.One more thing, this lock does not provide selectable adhesive spacer to keep the lock snug to the object to be locked.  Not a big deal considering the price.
summary: Good enough to deter potential theft

reviewText: Quieter than I thought it would be. I have to keep it pretty close to my face. I bought this for online gaming because I did not like the mic on the senheiser pc 360.
I've traveled extensively with this as my primary photo capture device, and it has never failed, even in the fine sunny climes of the Scottish Highlands (a little sarcasm there).
summary: Filled The Bill All Over the Planet

reviewText: I am very pleased with these headphones.  They produce great sound, are light weight and adjustable, and fold to a very compact size.My only complaint is that they came with an adapter for a large input jack (which is very rarely found) instead of an adapter for two prong jacks (which are required for using these headphones on an airplane).  I couldn't even find an adapter at Radio Shack so ended up listening to the audio on the airplane in one ear only.  Oh well, otherwise they're great.

As advertised, it is a for a Dell. This is, of course, NOT an actual Dell power cord. (for the price, I'm not surprised). It works just as advertised. My only complaint is that the cord is excessively short compared to others. You can add any other adapter to the end to extend it, but I would have preferred it be longer.

Works great, easy to setup except that the FM plug and one of the TV tuner inputs are the same color. Since my eyesight isn't very good, I assumed that the two black inputs were for the TV and the white one was for the FM tuner. I was wrong. The bottom two are the TV tuners. Once I got that right, the setup with Windows Media Center was easy and works great. I have two, one on a XP desktop and another on a Vista Premium laptop. With my eyesight who needs HD. Great price on Amazon,I spent more on a single tuner last year.

Other reviewers commented that the trackpad wouldn't click properly when placed in the Clique. My trackpad seems to work fine in the Clique I received, but it did take a couple of tries to get the keyboard and trackpad installed correctly. If you have trouble with your trackpad not clicking properly, pop it out, and try reinserting it. Slide the front edge into the Clique first, and then press the rear edge down. Make sure the trackpad is seated properly at all four corners and it should work for you.

This little beast certainly is worth ever penny. The processor is quite fast, and having 4 cores makes it a pretty good gaming processor. This processor would make a great HTPC. It stays cool, and the integrated graphics is great for movies. The only problem is that the integrated graphics are not really all that great for gaming. It can play low-intensity games well (like Minecraft, or older Windows 98 games), but modern games (Borderlands 2, specifically) only get about 20FPS on low settings. This is easily remedied by getting a PCIe video card, but then you may as well grab a better FX or Phenom CPU, too.
summary: Not a bad processor at all

reviewText: I've moved tons of photos and music without filling it up or maxing it out.  The only problem is that it's so small, I've misplaced itseveral times.  Does what it's supposed to.
kids love to put on phone
I needed a basic wireless mouse for work (no fancy scroll wheels for CAD) and this fit the bill perfectly.  It was a good price for basic functions.  I like that it only takes 1 AA battery.

My router, Medialink-N Broadband Router is practically in the same room as my TX-NR414 receiver. I should send it back, hopwe it's not too late. I tried everythng I could think of to get it to connect but nothing worked and tried what other's have suggested in their reviews.
summary: It does not work as advertised, router is practically in the same room as my TX-NR414 receiver. I should send it back

reviewText: i received this player 2 days ago and could not be more please with the sound quality. easy to navigate through  the menus. feels solidly built and the screen is bright enough so that it can easily be read in sunlight.

reviewerName: Patrick Connell ""Say what you mean and m...
reviewText: I have been shopping for a few months, both online and in stores for a 32in tv to replace 20in CRT tv in bedroom. Wanted to buy a Blu-ray player as well, so wanted 1080 res. Shopping around I could not find a 1080TV anywhere close to this price from a brand I know and trust like JVC; whose products I have used for decades with satisfaction.I have in my bedroom a JVC surround receiver, JVC DVD/VHS recorder, both of which have given and still give, reliable, excellent performance.I couldn't be happier than I am with this TV. A little tweaking with the settings and I get unreal clarity and color on screen. Blu-ray movies are amazing (Green Lantern looked unbelievable, almost 3 dimensional).While there may be "better" LCD TV's out there, for just over 3 bills, this one is hard to beat in terms of value, picture and sound quality. (Neglected to mention that the TV speakers sound quite nice compared to most other 32's I've heard). Not a great deal of whistles and bells, but more than adequate for a second bedroom TV.[ ... ]

Don't get me wrong, I really like this Navi and I think it's really all the navi you'd need.But then in the middle of a trip, right before that complicated intersection... it crashed and had to be rebooted - 5 minutes and the complicated intersection later it's back on and perfect again.I would still recommend it and buy it again.

I dropped my canon digital SLR T3i - yes - it happens ! And it fell on the lens (obviously the heavier part - especially if you have a long zoom lens...)The only thing that broke was this $2 filter - I was so happy. I have one on each of my lenses now...Enough said !
HAD ONE FROM A YEAR AGO STILL WORKING GREAT. SURE THIS ONE WILL TOO. 1TB IS NICE.. IT'S ALMOST AN UNLIMITED AMOUNT OF SPACE FOR STORAGE. NICE AND COMPACT, AND THE TOSHIBA QUALITY.

I do own other p&s; cameras besides Canon but admit to only owning Canon DSLRs; I'm kind of tied into the Canon lenses at this point.  I tried an Olympus as that was the brand I use for film, but was not at all happy with their DSLR image quality. As for Canon, I have owned the Rebel 300, 20d and 40d.  The 40d is a great camera and quite usable for the kind of photography I enjoy which is mostly landscape.  I decided to take the plunge and go for a full frame camera despite the price.  I have only used the 5d II about 4 times so far and only twice with the 40d for comparison, but feel pretty confident I can report on the differences.  The 2 cameras are nearly identical in color space and dynamic range not to mention resolution per pixel.  In other words if the image pixel count is the same on both cameras, you would be hard pressed to tell which camera took the picture.  The 5d II just has more pixels.  The 5d II trumps the 40d in several other areas too.* First is the high ISO range; I am very happy with 800-1600 ISO images and I use to only like to settle for ISO 100.* The 24-105L lens becomes a fantastic walk around lens because of the 21mp sensor, images can easily be cropped tight to a distant subject.* My 17-40L is now a true wide angle lens!* Shadows at low ISOs have more depth than the 40d.* Lens micro adjustments can make autofocus nearly perfect.  My 70-300 f5.6 back focuses on both bodies, but I was able to easily correct the issue on the 5d II.  I still have to manually adjust on the 40d.* The back screen is much more usable; I even started using live view mode for some shots.* Because of the resolution and dynamic range RAW images are quite flexible so I don't have to take as many variations.* Multiple resolutions to choose from even in RAW.* Better weather sealing is comforting as I do take the camera to places where it is misty and damp.* I've taken a couple of test movies which look lovely.  I just don't see myself using this feature too often.There is always room for improvement so here is my wish list for the mark III.* An internal flash for filling in shadows.* Frame rate of 5/sec would be nice even though I rarely need it.* The ability to select the range for the auto ISO feature; I'd love to be able to limit the range to 200-800 for certain situations.* A pivoting back display is something that I miss from my old Nikon point and shoot cameras.  It's really useful when shooting macros or for events where your shooting over people's heads.

I have multiple of these Anker chargers for the wall, and I love how you can use EITHER port for Android, and everything is hunky-dory. The charge is pretty rapid from dead, meaning when the phone turns itself off, it will revive pretty quickly.MY ONLY suggestion is to always watch the prices! They change so frequently. Recently it was out of stock for about a month on Amazon, and when they came back they went up at $15 per unit, then that same week, they were $12.99!
summary: A great product that ACTUALLY WORKS! Just make SURE you watch their pricing, it's ALWAYS changing ($12-16)

reviewText: It could be those little things that go around your ears, but they don't seem to fit me perfectly.The little rubber part that goes in your ear fits better, but it seems to fit better in one ear than the other - leaving me with that feeling like you have water in one ear.Because of the loops that go around your ears, you can't really adjust them very much after they are in place - at least not that I have found.So far, I've only worn them for 1 week at the gym, but they are doing what I wanted: They don't fall out when I'm doing pull-ups, squats, or running on the treadmill.Oh, and back to the little rubber part that goes in your ear: Since it does not actually go INTO your ear like an earplug would, they don't block the surrounding noise very well. That's good if you are going to walk or jog along the side of the road, but leaves you listening to both your music and the crap they are playing at the gym at the same time. Meh.

This is a really good headset. My favorite ones for the price! The best part about it is that it has a built-in-line subwoofer that if you turn it all the way up, it is like an earthquake. The complaint about the subwoofer is that it uses an AA battery, they could have used a button cell battery. It is also really bulky, but it does have a belt clip to make it better. Another good thing is that Skullcrushers fold up so that you can put it into a carrying bag; very convienient for travel. It is over-ear, and the padding is very soft. I could wear them all day and my ears would not hurt at all from the headset like they would with on-ear headphones; very comfortable headphones. The last complaint that I have is that they are not as loud as some other skullcandy headphones. They could have given them a bigger transducter than 30mm. That is why I gave it only 4 stars. But they make up for the volume loss in the bass. If you are looking for loud headphones, get the Hesh, but they do not have a good bass. Personally, I like these better than Hesh. I guess it is just how you like your music.
summary: Awesome, but could be a little louder

reviewText: I upgraded from klipsch KG 2.5s floor standing speakers. These are compact yet powerful. Full range sound with a little to much emphasis on bass, but that is easily adjusted within the amp.

I love DSM and the speed of this thing. But I have issues (hangs on shutdown, hangs on restart).This is an old unit, please get the DS412+ is more current.Mine arrived incomplete, without screws and other stuff, but Amazon refund 20% of the price (as always Amazon have the best customer service on earth).I will purchase more Synology (rackstations) for small bussiness because I know they are very good, expensive, but good.
summary: hangs on boot up. plex is bad. great NAS

reviewText: I was sort of dreading getting a new modem to replace the one leased from AT&T Broadband.  You know how every new thing for a PC takes a day or two out of your life to get it set up?  Not with this!  AT&T support had me up and running in less than 20 minutes.  (The support guy said his record for Best Data modems is 8.5 minutes, but I held him up because I hadn't even unpacked it, yet.)Seems to run faster than the 3COM I had before, but I don't really have an objective way to measure that.

To purchase a new factory battery from Neuton would have cost me about $100. For about half of that amount I purchased this set of batteries which fit in the original factory battery case. If you are somewhat handy, the replacement of the old cells for these new cells is reasonably easy. These battieries are lighter than the originals, so long term service is a concern. So far they provide enough charge for me to do my three small lawns.So far, this has been a good purchase.  It is too soon to tell how long these will last, hopefully, as long as the original cells, about 5 years.

For music, this deck sounds great but I bought it for the BT functions which do not work well at all. It pipes the incoming caller through the speakers and that is fine, the major problem is with the BT mic in the deck picking up every little sound inside the car and the road noise while driving. I have to stop the car so people can hear me and that totally defeats the purpose of having this set-up. I did a little test and called my house phone with it while hearing for noises in and around the car. I could very lightly tap on the rear, outside of the car and hear it in my house phone. Pretty ridiculous. I'm only giving the three stars for the music quality.

In my house we have a lot of mobile devices, from iPhones, iPads, to iPods.  Always looking around for the charger for all of these so I thought I would try this out.  It's a usb charger where you plug in the charing cables into the ports and then it charges your device.  There is on special port for iPad with the rest being for iPhone, IPod type devices.  When charging one device it works well.  I have noticed though that when charging more devices the time to fully charge our devices goes down some.  Not a scientific observation, but it seemed like my phone was charging slower when my wife's iPad was charging.  Also, if you are looking for something to better organize all the charging cables, this is not the solution.  Even though you have one power cord, you still need the charging cable from your device and that can create a cord mess.  We don't unplug the cables after each charge, we leave them plugged in so we can just attache the device.  The CHIL PowerShare does not have storage for the charging cables, only for the power cord.  Not a deal breaker but keep it in mind if you are looking for better organization of your counter.

I bought this a few months ago and I love it. I bought it for my Canon T3i.Pros:Works greatgreat battery lifeSmall and can be tied to my camera bagCons:Doesnt have a far range so you have to be close and infront of the camera.

I had hoped the hub would be able to accept a SuperDrive and charge my iPad. Unfortunately, it could not and I had to rethink my connection strategy.I'm going to keep the hub, but it isn't as good as I'd hoped it would be.

I've had this unit for a few weeks now. I had the 10 inch b4 and it was a great little machine. Unfortunately my girlfriend luved it and I gave it to her which proved to be a good desicion, if u know what I mean. So, I decided to get this 11 inch with the dual core and bigger HD and I luv it more even than the previous one. It's not blazing fast and it boots up slower than my desktop, but its great for taking out on the patio and the living room. I have a couple of Acer tablets the 7 Inch and the 10 Inch. I havnt even turned them on since I got this unit. I'll prob giv those to my kids.  This is a little workhorse and I can create my MS word docs and do everything my desk top can do, except burn a DVD. I'm glad I got it. I got it at the Wally store for a lot less than the price here. Shop around. But, get one.
summary: Does wat its supposed to do and does it well

reviewText: When I first got the headphones they fell out and did not reduce ambient noise.Then I found this little card in the earphone pouch that has instructions.  I put my comments in parenthesis.1. Flanged eartips: Moisten before insertion (I am not sure how to do this when out and about, certainly not spit, yuck.)2. Foam eartips: Roll eartip between fingers and thumb; place in ear canal and hold for 5 seconds. (Kinda a pain and then you put finger skin and oil into your ear, yuck.)3. Use a twisting motion as you slide eartip in you ears. (This is what I tried to do intuitively, and it doesn't work without the next step.)4. Pull up-and-out on the side of your ear to open up the ear canal. (This is what did it for me, and better a way to write the sentence: Use one hand to pull your ear lobe up-and-out as you insert the flanged eartip with the other hand.)5. Open your jaw slightly while inserting the eartip. (Makes no difference to me)6. For some ears, insert in-an-up, not just straight inward. (I did this intuitively once I tried step 4. and it worked.)4 Stars and not 5 because base response is not as good as many of the other headphones that I have tried.  But they work great for audiobooks.
summary: Follow Instructions for noise reduction and staying put

reviewText: It was a gift for my mother-in-law who is in a nursing home.  She likes to take it with her to show movies to her friends at the home.  That has been going on for about 3 years now.  As she is getting more forgetful these days, it was important that this little player was also easy to use, which it is.

This camera bag is absolutely what I was looking for.  I'm a huge fan of Lowepro bags and own or have owned about a dozen of them.  But I was looking for a more inconspicuous bag an none of the Lowepro bags I looked at fit the bill exactly.  I accidentally found this bag while looking at reviews on YouTube and was immediately hooked.  It's big, yes, but at least it doesn't scream, "PHOTOGRAPHER!"  I can fit my 60D with a Canon 24-70 f/2.8, a 70-200mm f/2.8 IS USM II, and a flash.  On the two outside pockets I stash three diapers size 4 and 5 and on the other side some wet wipes.  Although this bag is big I'd never fill it all the way because this thing can get pretty heavy.My only negative is the silent mode. There's a built in system where you can cover up the velcro so you don't make a sound when opening but now there's nothing stopping your equipment from just sliding out.  I guess I would use that feature if I had my bag stationary on the floor or a pew and need quick access to gear.  It would have been great if maybe they added a small clip just in case.All in all it is a great camera bag and I highly recommend it for work and play.  Great material, great look, and practical  storage system inside.  Maybe it's time to move to Think Tank.

Have had this router for about a month.  Huge improvement over the low end Netgear unit it replaced.  The benefit of multi-antenna and ability to have a separate guest account without visibility to your internal network is awesome.  I had massive problems with the DHCP on the Netgear unit, always having conflicts.  No issues with this unit and the range is fantastic considering all the lathe and plaster walls in our home.  Gigabit LAN connectivity is perfect for the connecting it into the rest of the home LAN network.  We connect several devices, XBox, Wii, DS, multiple PCs, iPhones, iPad, and a DNS-323 to our network.  I'm not a network guru and found that setup was very straightforward, much cleaner than Netgear.  So far so good, so I hope it lasts a while.

For the last 15 years, I  had multiple desktops and laptops. Most recent an $800 Asus i7 with 8GB Ram. So many issues, crappy sound card, screen burns, hard drive failure, sent back couple of times for repair, all in one year. Just got fed up and read the reviews on Apple products on Amazon . Didn't understand what everyone was raving and getting so emotionally attached about.. Convinced by the reviews, I ordered my first Apple product. I am blown away. My Mac has an i5 and it blows away my i7 on the Asus. The i7 is probably slow due to heavy bloatware. The screen clarity is unbelievable. Crisp, sharp and processor speed is unreal. MacBook has back light keyboard , another awesome feature. The download is really fast. No plastic bezel or plastic casing. Aluminum casing and it looks sharp and so beautiful. I am shocked at how well this machine is designed and built. I work as an engineer. I pay a lot of attention to detail , especially when it comes to form and function. Windows coupled with HP/DELL/ASUS are like circus clowns compared to this fine machine. I cannot believe all these years I missed out on such great product. Well built, really really fast, great audio, great video,  aesthetically pleasing...Great job..Time for me to sell all my other Windows run machines and buy Apples. This is it...
summary: Wow..my first Mac..Blows Windows away..Never seen anything like this...

reviewText: For the price it is just OK.  It is very lightly made and I doubt it can handle frequent business travel.  I use it to carry my 17 inch laptop from home to office occassionally.  It has a small amount of storage space in the front section with some pockets and slots, but clearly not for heavy use.
summary: Fine for storage and maybe a trip to the office

reviewText: I purchased this for use at my desk at work.  I spend quite a bit of time at my desk, and listening to music helps my productivity and drowns out office noise.  I use the amp with both headphones (Sennheiser PX100) and desktop speakers (Pyle 4 inch).  I am very happy with the quality of sound that I am getting with this setup.It is definitely not audiophile level sound, but much better than the a headphone connected to the earphone jack.  My PC, an Asus EEE 900HA, has a very noisy DAC.  Also, since this devices can drive speakers in addition to headphones.You should note that the DAC only support 16 bit depth.  I guess I would get better sound if it was 24 bit, but it is absolutely fine for it's intended use.Also, I should mention that it does not feel quite as robust as my old headphone amp that I used to use (I forgot the brand).  That amp cost about twice the price, and did not have a DAC or drive speakers.  This amp does not feel particularly flimsy, but just not as bulletproof as my old device.All in all, I am tempted to rate it at 4 stars, but I'm not sure exactly why.  I can't pinpoint anything that disappoints, it just does not seem to inspire a 5 star rating.  I may update my rating after I have had the product for a few more months.
summary: I'm very happy with my TP30

reviewText: Excellent product - everything I hoped/expected (I was in the "storage business" until I retired a few years ago.)However, I did experience minor problems that were overcome after LL formatting the four Seagate drives which I installed in the SS4200-E. (Thanks Chuck!)I use this NAS on my domestic 1Gb network to serve three active PCs.  It offers a 2TB RAID 5 array that uses 4x Seagate 750GB Barracuda drives.If there were more available, I'd buy another one in a heartbeat...However, I should say that this product, with the LACK of support for it, is inappropriate for inexperienced users.
came fast, a bit expensive, i think there should be more for the money, over all seems to be fine, tested it and works fine, should have a telescoping wond too make it more controlable

I wanted to be able to watch streaming movies from Amazon and Netflix without having to go out and buy a new expensive TV, and wasn't ready to give up my laptop for the duration of a movie to do so.  This player looked like it would fit the bill... and it did!  And easily!We have an HDTV that was not internet ready, and we use satellite tv connection.  All I had to do with this player was hook up the HDMI cable to the television, turn on the player, and it found our wireless internet router in the house for our DSL.  (Forget it if you are stuck using satellite internet.)  The remote allowed me to update the software, just following the on-screen instructions.  The remote also has a bright red button which connects automatically to Netflix where I can either select movies on-screen or play the movies I've added to the queue when I was sitting at my computer.  It just doesn't get any easier!  And the best part is I was even able to show my husband how to find movies online on his computer so we can choose from them as well.  (He's not into chick flicks.)Also playing DVD's is super easy.  Just wave your hand over the top and the motion detector pops open the tray, place your DVD in the tray, then wave your hand again, and the movie is ready to go.  I didn't consider the price tag excessive for the player, cable and Netflix account monthly fee or the Amazon Prime benefit of all the movies included in my membership.We don't have a 3D TV, but when we're ready to move in that direction, this player will handle it, as well as Blu-Ray if we get any of them.  Hooking up the internet was a mystery to me (and I'm very computer savvy), but the chart on Amazon made it easy to find equipment that would be compatible.  I happened to be attracted to the slim box too.  It is no taller than the base for our television.  We've been watching several movies every night since we got it a month ago.  I highly recommend this to anyone looking for an inexpensive way to connect your tv to the internet.  We love ours!

I've been buying mp3 players for over a year. With each one I buy, I planned on keeping it if I was happy. After 6 mp3 players, I've finally settled. I've been through an Creative Zen Micro, iRiver H10, Philips PSA612, Toshiba Gigabeat F40, and have returned all of them for various reasons. This Creative Zen Vision:M is a keeper!The screen is absolutely gorgeous. My friends at work who have an iPod video say theirs are better... until they see the screen, and then their mouths just drop.Another advantage is the compatability. You're not going to be stuck to some format like Apple who will trap you further and further into their money making traps, but with this, you're set free! Mp3, WMA, Divx, xVid, WMV, mp4... your options are wide open!The touchpad takes a little time to get used to, but it's well worth the effort. Face it, when a person first uses a mouse, it's awkward, but it's extremely easy to everyone now. It just takes some time.The dongle is a little annoying as you have to use it to transfer music or to charge up. I wish it would just charge and trasfer over a regular USB cord, but Apple doesn't have that either.

I was looking to get a new 35 mm fast lens but with the cost of Canon's latest 35 F2.0IS where it is, I decided to go for this while the 25% ($50) rebate was on.My lens was definitely a return, although everything and warranty was there. I could tell since the inside plastic package had been opened and there was slight dust on the fron element (externally only). Returns scare me but there are a lot of returns for frivolous reasons, so I decided to try this out for 30 days.All I can say is wow! this lens is sharp wide open, high contrast and perfect focus with no microadjust on my 6D. So I took blew the dust off the front element, and tested some more. This a keeper, very low CA (if any and sharp. Contrast and color are really good. Light fall-off wide open is there, but almost any software automatically corrects that, and the 6D and other newer bodies correct in camera itself for Jpegs. Same with distortion, its very low and better than most zooms and primes except the true Macro lenses.With a metal mount and nice build, its a no brainer compared to even the plastic fantastic 50 F1.8, which 1 1/3 stop faster and is "toy-like and noisier in its feel", but that one stop dosent hurt when I can shoot at 6400~12,800 ISO without worrying about noise on the 6D. We don't worry about ISO speed as much today as in the film days.I shoot most fast lenses at f2.8~f4 anyways since I don't like one eye in focus and the other not. Others may love F1.2 etc, not me, I'm just not that artistic enough with razor thin DOF. Bokeh on this lens is equal to lenses costing 5 to 10 times more.What really was nice surpise to me was the 40 mm perspective. As mentioned I believed the 35 and 85 mm focal lenths were more classic and 40 was oddball. Shoot a waist high portrait at 40 mm see what you think with this lens. Its almost like what you see normally and it is a very realistic perspective. I have zoom lenses that do 40 mm but never really shot at 40 mm, for what ever reason. It may not help with people who are very "round", but for slim/thin people, it looks great!The lens is so light and with the new light FF bodies like a 6D, you have a camera that isn't going to tire you out, even around yor neck or in your hand all day long!The STM motor is a little noiser and slower than a USM in most lenses, but is much better than the micro-usm in the 50 F1.4. Not a deal breaker by far for me, and may be a help with video (which I don't do much) when zooming with the T4i and T5i , since they optimized (in some way) for it, according to Canon. In the real world, it dsen't matter to me.
summary: This lens belongs in every kit.

reviewText: I will update this review if the cable fails in the future but as of now it works great. And as long as you are not planing to take in and out a 1000 times then it will last forever.

Pros:1. Awesome sound in a little device.2. USB drive and multi memory cards reader3. Well made/designed4. Excellent price5. Sound is clear and bass is pretty darn goodCons:1. NO bluetooth connection!!!!2. If you are  using a flash/memory card you WON'T be able to select songs/Artist/Genre to be played.  This is a big downer since memory cards can hold hundreds/thousands of songs and one MUST go 'SKIPPING' songs until one reaches desired song/artist.I gave it a three star rating based on sound and quality, which would be equivalent to a five star rating.  Took two stars off due to the "Cons", listed above.  I had searched for "Bluetooth Speaker" and this one showed up.  IT was my mistake to think it was capable to provide such a functionality.I totally recommend this little speaker if the "CONS" above do NOT apply to your NEEDS.  You can actually feel the AIR that comes out of the buffer on the back!!!!

I really like this case. I bought one for my iPod at a big box store and paid 25. I really like it because of the overall protection it provides and access it allows. This case can stay on while in a docking station with very little interference if any. I also like it because of the way it wraps around the front of the iPod. On many of the minimalist cases, they just wrap around the lip of the iPod and provide very little protection to the front. They also tend to lift and create bubbles on screen protectors. Because this case is made of a softer rubber and wraps around the front, it doesn't cause a problem with the screen protector. My son is very finicky about any case on his and went without due to the bibles caused by many. I had him try mine and he loved it. He still has it on, which is saying a lot about the product. I got this one from Amazon because if the price and green shipping. I only gave it four stars, because I still wish that there was either a belt loop or something for me to allow it to be worn. I like to use it at work and need to have my hands free. Overall, this is a very good product to provide minimalist protection and great function.

I installed this on my 2008 late Mac book without a hitch.  I never done this before and didn't need any instructions.  It was simple unscrew the bottom panel take out all the screws from the superdrive unplug the connections pull it out and put this in.  I installed one of those sanddisk SDD and moved the original drive to this.  My laptop works superfast!  I love that I don't have to buy a new laptop this should hold me over for another year at least.

For those undecided on which set to buy in the 46-52" size, look no further. I looked and researched for 2 months before I decided on this beauty. The picture is spot on right out of the box.I'm sure that some tweaking of the custom settings will help even further but I intend to allow a break-in period before I attempt that. I would say a $300 professional calibration is unnecessary on this particular HDTV. Invest in a midlevel Blu-Ray player with the dough(Panasonic's Bd60 is a solid choice). The audio is very adequate for regular viewing contrary to other reviews. For true home theatre nirvana though, a decent receiver that decodes HD audio is a must. When I finish my home theatre it will be very hard to leave home for the local cinema.
This was the cheapest of the lot. We've had it for about 6 months now and use it in the car to connect an iphone/ipod to the stereo system. It works well and was a great price.

I've been using Anker products for a few years now, mostly their batter packs (Astro line). I needed a bluetooth keyboard for travelling with my iPad Air and I found that Anker has this keyboard! It's terrific! Bluetooth 3.0. Easy pairing. A great steal at the price they're asking and works like a dream with my iPad and my Macbook Pro. Anker never lets me down.PROS:+ Incredibly repsonsive - no typing delays or communication problems!! (Hooray!)+ Bluetooth 3.0+ iPad specific buttons across the top row of keys (home, brightness, lock, etc)+ Easy on/off toggle and quick pairing setup+ Slim form factor+ Uses two AAA batteries (I prefer this for travel since rechargeable requires an outlet)+ Good keyboard feedback and tactile sense+ Stylish designCONS:+ Not sure how long the AAA batteries last, but I've probably accumulated something around 6hr already and no signs of fatigue.+ the LED power light on the front can be somewhat distracting in a dim room
summary: Excellent alternative to more expensive bluetooth keyboards!

reviewText: I bought both the 16gb and 4gb version of these for use around the office and when traveling to move files between multiple computers and devices.  It's amazes me that a device so small can hold so much data and I found the product to work flawlessly with both Windows and Mac Operating Systems without the need to format them - which is great considering SanDisk used to have issues with Mac OS X.  The only problem I have with these drives, which is minor, is that on my 15" MacBook Pro, the drive itself is too wide which means I have to unplug other things in the ports surrounding the USB slot in order for this drive to fit. I'm not sure whether it's an issue with SanDisk or that Apple put the ports to close together but in any case, it's a small annoyance that I don't feel warrants overall points being taken away.

Read all the reviews, did my homework, bought this in Aug06.  Wonderful while it worked and one day it was dead, DEC06(right before a trip!).  First contacted tech support by email (6 day turnaround), called (30-35 min hold time), emailed again.  Still waiting for a RMA #.  Unit is 4.5 stars.  Customer Service 0.
I have had this item for almost a year and it still works like a charm. It has a great fit that I wouldn't complain about and it looks great too.

Setup was very simple and straightforward.  Going from a G router that is about 10 years old I expected to see a big increase in speed, but haven't noticed a big change.  I think that has more to do with our incoming service rather than the router itself though.
Make sure you plug in both ends.  Warning- this cable does not work if the devices are more than a foot apart!

I love these and would recommend them.  My ears start to hurt a bit after about an hour -- these aren't exactly made of cotton.  But none of these products are.  These sound is acceptable, they are flexible enough to bend with me in bag or at the gym, and they are super convenient.  Also, there is microphone and accessible music controls on the wire, which has proved very convenient.

I'm giving this product a 1 star rating because when I try to use my LG Bluray player and set the 1021-K receiver to BD, the 1021-K receiver switches the input to TV/SAT while the bluray player is in the process of booting up with no input from me. I switch the receiver back to BD and it switches back to TV/SAT, over and over again. If I stick with it, after 15-20 minutes I MAY be able to get it to stay on BD as the selected input. It is quite frustrating that the 1021-K will not stay set to the input I selected. Unfortunately, I'm outside the return period or this wouldn't be my problem, it would be Amazon's.Edit: I changed my original review to 4 stars,taking 1 star away for crummy documentation. The problem I had was solved by going to the HDMI setup menu and turning control OFF. See page 64 of the manual for a description of how to do it. The problem and solution is described on Page 34 of the avsforums thread for the 1021. Here is a link.[...]The documentation for the 1021 is abysmal. There should be a quick guide to solving problems one is likely to encounter, but that is not included. Other than the extremely frustrating problem I had with the bluray player, it has been a very fine receiver for me.
summary: Switches Between BD and TV/SAT With No User Input

reviewText: This does the job for cleaning my sensor. I wish they would include more swabs. I would have paid more to save the hassle of ordering more of them.
First the spinner thing broke and didn't work anymore, then the plug in fell apart however for the time it worked it was nice and I got my value out of it

Beyond phenomenal in looks, great sound, better if they were just a bit closer to your ears, but I got them to ride at night, so I could hear traffic on my bike.  although I use them from time to time in the house.  Truly phenomenal build quality and matching pouch! AAA++++

I purchased this keyboard for both gaming and heavy-typing. The Cherry MX Red switches provide a great balance of comfort and functionality when doing both. I prefer a more responsive keystroke and the red switches really are sensitive for this, but not too sensitive. This was my first mechanical keyboard, as I was coming from a 1st generation G15, and I immediately fell in love with the responsive bounce I get while typing. For gaming, the ability to switch the CTRL and Caps Lock, disable Windows key, and smaller body really appealed to me. The smaller frame gives me plenty of room for a larger mousepad. The keyboard is not flashy with LED's and sharp edges. It's a minimalist design and feels very solid. There's nothing cheap feeling about this keyboard. Despite the description saying so, my keyboard WAS sent with a key puller!I'm just blown away by how amazing this keyboard really is. Add to cart now.
I liked it, it's not sticky it's the rubber in it that stays put and it can be stored in a small space
I ran out of USB 3.0 ports on my motherboard and didn't need more than 6 so i used this to just be able to use my final font USB port as a 2.0 port.  Works well, small, only maybe 3-4 inches.

My Receiver said this dock was specifically made for it, however, there is no on-screen display at all.  The audio is decent, but the only thing you can see is the actual ipod menu.  Nothing comes up on the receiver display or the TV, so this is basically useless to try to control from a distance.  This is pretty worthless

I've had this power adapted for just over a month now and it's been working great. I hate with every fiber of my being that it costs so much to replace an Apple magsafe power adapted - however, i will never buy the non-brand one again. I replaced those two and just gave in and paid the $80 for this product

I recently installed this in my Dell XPS 8300 (Intel Core i5, 6GB ram, 1TB hard disk, 460W power supply). Installation was easy, but when I turned the system on the stock fan on this card howled. I could hear it over my second computer and TV. When I installed the EVGA utility software, I noticed it said the fan volume was on low. I adjusted it ti high and it tripled the noise level. I pulled this card and am returning it to Amazon. It's been awhile since I bought a video card (my last was a Geforce 8600GTS years ago) but if this is the new normal for volume on lower end video cards, I'm going to passive cooling or none at all. I'm assuming this was just a bad/defective stock fan. This card would blow away my old 8600 card in decibels. My use of this computer is going to be casual titles, and older classics on GOG. I might play Civilization IV and V but beyond that I'm a console gamer. My previous card was EVGA so I know they are a decent brand. Don't rule them out completely if you are reading this.

This was not the case of my dreams, but I'm cheap and it was one of the few that rotated and had a stylus holder. For the past 5 months it's worked just fine, which is a little disappointing as I kind of wanted it to break to justify buying a cutesy girly one. It's held my pad in place and hasn't held in any dirt to scuff the back of my pad. The swivel is smooth but not floppy. The first groove is worthless, but the other too are fine as long as you don't pound on your i pad while caught in the fervor of a game. The magnetic feature has given little problem as long as I'm mindful of positioning. The only problems I've had are after 3 months or so, the rubber strip around the case started to peel off. While it was distracting and I had to stop padding to peel it, it hasn't affected anything. A week or so ago, the black finish started to peel off in one corner. However, I think that's probably due to my jealous cat biting that corner frequently in her attempts to eat my pad. If you are cheap, want a pretty good case that will rotate and hold your stylus and don't have a crazy pad-eating cat, this is the one to get. If it came in a pretty girly color/finish, I'd have given it the 5th star.
WORKS AS DESCRIBED .. OWNED 3 YEARS NOW AND WORKS WELL.. NO COMPLAINTS HERE.  GREAT PRODUCT AT AN EXCELLENT PRICE
None of the things contained are of high quality. They do the job well enough and they give you enough microfiber cleaning cloths to last a lifetime.
summary: What you might expect for 10 bucks

reviewText: Useful case...not sure if I will have much use for it other than the one time I used it on a road trip.  Friends used it in the backseat to watch movies, play games, and listen to music.  It held the iPad in place and was useful to have with us.  Also doubled as a case when we took it out of the car.  I am sure that a family might have more use for this, especially keeping the kids quiet on long trips.  It was simple to install in the car, too.A basic product that does what it says.

Purchased this case for a Sony WX-300 camera. This fits a compact carry camera perfectly. What I particular like is that the zippers don't touch the camera possibly causing scratches when you zip and unzip the case. A great buy.

I am surprised that amazon asked me to write a review for this product. I am not big on words so I will be brief. These holder hold to discs in 1/2 the space a standard case is. I had been a collector but of late I am selling off as much as I can. Anything I can convert to digital I am. I feel digital is the future. Look at Amazon stream and netflix and you understand what I mean. But there are some discs I wish to keep and these are great for those. You can add art but I just put the discs facing out. Why waste the paper? But I probably have 2 thousand discs. I am selling them off on amazon for pennies on a dollar. That's life. If something where to happen to me I don't want to burden my family with getting rid of more than they have to. The kids are teens so all the discs and tapes they watched I am selling. But these are great for those you want to keep. Funny thing my wife said about 8 years ago. She said "I hear that soon we will be able to download any movie to our TV." I laughed at her. Who is stupid now? I want to know who she thinks will win the next Superbowl and what the spread will be. You never know.
summary: GOOD QUALITY DISC HOLDER THAT SAVES SPACE

reviewText: I had to download the newest drivers but once installed everything worked great.  The included extender cable and cradle comes in handy and lets you move it to a higher spot.

I am not familiar with the Basics line from Amazon.  This is a sleek little speaker set, requires 4 AA batteries.  I initially tried my iPod Nano, an older version, and though it worked, you could barely hear anything even with both sets of volumes turned way up.  Worked just fine with my iPhone 4...not sure I maxed out eithre volume so I;m not sure if the sound becomes tinny but it's perfect for your desk.  Not sure it would fill a patio though would work if you were laying out at the pool or something.Will update my review as I use this product more often.

I bought this unit as part of a Windows 7 PC kit build in December 2010. Worked ok for 2 years. But it was a light 2 years. I only ripped about 25 CDs, never burned a DVD, never played a DVD etc in the 2 years. Went to listen to a CD last night, and the drive is not recognized by the computer. Did a diagnostic check, and I get a report of a bad driver. Can't find a driver on the internet (all kinds of Firmware updates, but each of those comes with a warning not to use if your problem is that your drive can't be detected). All troubleshooting sites say your driver is bundled in your Windows 7 OS, so you can't get the driver ala carte. Bottom line, I am suddenly without an operational drive, no way to fix. I am left one option - buy a new drive. You can bet it will not be LG.

I purchased this to protect my Edge 800. It has the necessary open on the back side so that you mount your Edge on a bracket, and otherwise fits exactly as a skin should. The front edge rolls onto the face and is ridged a little so that if your Edge takes a tumble you should have some front protection. I'm pleased.

I am using this switch for a home built experimental Hadoop cluster.The unit stays cool to the touch when it's idle and gets warm to the touch when in use for prolonged periods (after more than 30 minutes of high traffic it becomes noticeably warm). Fortunately, unlike my previous switch which connected my boxes, this one never feels like I could fry eggs on it.There's not really much useful information to add. I do wish there were separate indicator LEDs on the back where the cables connect but that's really not a major detractor since once my machines are set up everything runs flawlessly. I haven't encountered any set up issues or incompatibilities, it just works.There is zero noise because of its fanless design. I'd recommend keeping it in an open area where it can stay well-ventilated but if you're reading this review, I suppose that's kind of par for the course.Final Verdict:I have no problem recommending this switch.
summary: Low heat, No noise, Great performance. Zero complaints

reviewText: This keyboard is great. I originally got it to control my media center PC from the couch, and it does that very well. The touchpad is a little finicky, but it works for the limited times I've needed a mouse. As a secondary note, my cat loves the laser.

this product really doesn't fit either product it was ordered for...too small by a tiny bit for an easy fit for the tablet and it is too big, but usable (if the user is really careful) for an e-reader.
summary: Too small for what it was intended, too big, but okay for an e-reader

reviewText: I used this to mount a camcorder to various locations in my vehicle when doing videos and it works great.  I don't get any camera movement when driving and it fits snug with the rubber coating holding everything tight.  Combine that with the fact that I can use it with a variety of RAM mount setups that I have it is universally versatile between my car or my motorcycle (or any other form of transportation for that matter).
summary: RAM mount is the way to go for me.

reviewText: This is my second camera after my Fuji S9500 DSLR like camera. The upgrade is worlds apart as this is my first venture into the proper DSLR field. The D90 is a steady, reliable, consistent workhorse for all types of photography, providing superb quality and performance. I did extensive research before purchase and was actually looking at the Canon 550D (T2i) instead, but after reading about the D90 and using one from my friend I was sold.The lens that comes with it, 18-105mm, is a good all-round lens and can cover close ups to average portraits. You can't go wrong with this camera but be prepared to read through the lengthy manual for the various settings and fairly confusing menu system. But trust me, you'll rarely reach for your camera manual when you're busy capturing special moments or candids of the world around you.The battery life is amazing, with over 800 shots per charge. The controls are fairly easy to use and right where you need them. The Nikon technology behind the D90 makes life easier for you by doing most of the nitty gritty hard work and lets you focus on composition and capture.If you're unsure of your purchase of a Nikon D90, I can assure you, this camera will be either you're primary or your secondary in time to come.I love my D90!!Cheers!
summary: An insane intermediate camera for the budget photographer

reviewText: This has great build quality and a very professional look, I've used it with a nexus 7 and Kindle fire. I use 3M automotive tape to secure the tablet to the stand and the stand to the counter.  In one of my installs as a test the counter lifted off the ground and the tablet was still secure.  If you're looking for a semi-secure stand for a professional implementation I recommend this stand.
summary: Used for a commercial installation 7 inch tablet

reviewText: Plastic is slippery.  This iPod case is not.  I have not dropped myiPod yet so I cannot comment on that protection, but case will not moveeasily on a table top unless you pick iPod up (possibly saving a fall).The cutouts for what you need to push and attach to the iPod are wellplaced.  No problem connecting anything or adjusting volume when case ison your unit.A good case/cover which I recommend.

reviewText: I bought this speaker cloth to reface a pair of Paradigm speakers.  The cloth was dense and offered two different patterns depending on what side the speaker cloth is applied by.  The cloth was decently thick and hid the speakers.  The reason for four stars is because the black could be deeper.  Next to my other Paradigm speakers, the cloth has a slight purple hue to it.  For the price, its a great buy.

I've owned this camera for a couple of weeks now and I must say I am quite pleased with my purchase. You really can't beat the features/price of this camera. I'm a complete novice and I'm finding this camera very easy to learn to use and take clean pictures.When I first was trying to decide which model to buy, I was a bit apprehensive concerning Sony's use of proprietary Memory Sticks. Well, I'm happy to say that not only has Lexar began selling their own branded type of Memory Sticks but, SanDisk has just signed a deal to resell Memory Sticks also. That should not only drive the costs down but, it will make it simpler to find them in stock.I should also mention that the battery life is pretty good on this model and I find the fact that the battery tells you how much life it has left before needing a recharge quite usefull. All in all, I love this camera and am very happy to have jumped into Digital Photography with this model.
summary: Ease of Use and Great Pictures.

reviewText: I tested this over 10 hours with various distances and configurations with the Linksys signal monitor on.  You can watch the signal/noise numbers jump up and down.  With this product, in some cases, you will get some gain and in some cases, you'll get zero gain.  It depends on where the wireless access point is located and what it in the way. For what you are paying $50+, just go ahead and get an WRT54GX SRX router through TigerDirect.com, get a linksys repeater (range expander), or an access point in repeater mode.
summary: If this costs $9.99, then buy it

reviewText: if using usb3, this drive is really quick and 4 terabytes of storage is great for all pc backups.  I use it to back up my personal photo albums (over 8000 pictures) without making a dent.  I back up a 120 gig, 160 gig, 450 gig and 2 250 gig drives weekly and there is so much more room.  great product for the price!

reviewText: We bought this a few weeks back to use with our laptop that we have connected to our TV.  It works great.  It is just the right size.  It is actually bigger then I thought it was going to be.

Who can really review an auxiliary audio cable unless they've owned it for a while? I've owned two of these. I was impressed by the "Monster" brand name and it looked like this would be a moderately priced cable with a higher build quality. Of course, the main issue with these kinds of cables is how long they last. Well, not long. The plastic outer sleeve separated almost as soon as we started using the cable. You will do just as well with the no-name cables you find elsewhere, including on Amazon. I wish that I had an alternate brand to recommend, but unfortunately, it seems that building long lasting audio cables is not a big priority for any mass market manufacturer.

I would not spend $300 on the Bose SoundDock System unless there was a reason to do so. For example, I have a friend who is a Teacher, and he uses it while grading papers after school in his classroom. I use it in my RV, it fills up a small area with more than enough good sound. This is not "audiophone"  sound we are are taking about, but given the proper application for useage it's worthy of it's $300 price tag.In summary Bose knows how to make products that serve their purpose so well, you have to buy from them. Don't expect to hear fantastic sound from this unit, just the best sound that serves your purpose. Fo my personal purpose I have to cough up the $300 dollars to entertain myself.I would give the Bose SoundDock System six stars, if that were possible, but Bose would have drop their price by about 20%.
Does the job it's suppose to. All metal which is nice for such a cheap product. Would buy more if I need them
My wife bought this because it is purple...and a nice purple.  However, it took about a week for the strap to pull out.

The first one that was shipped didn't work, was DOA. I contacted the seller, they immediately answered and offered to ship a replacement at no charge, which they did. I didn't even have to return the dead one. I received the new one a few days later. It worked fine. I usually use it when I travel, to hook up the laptop to the HDTV at the hotel. The 15ft length is great. You can have the laptop anywhere in the hotel room and reach the TV.I am not sure about the long term durability of this one, if anything happens I will come back in and update. So far I have tested it on a few devices at home, and used it maybe 6-7 times while travelling over a couple of months, and it has been great.
It is just ok not great.  Colors are ok but lighting not very well distributed.  should have more bulbs I think.  Large print is great.
Work as expected. I'll get another one.

I have re-used my empty box from the previous cases I had.  Realistically, this saves on cardboard so it shouldn't be a complaint.

If you need to replace your Asus laptop battery, this works as expected. When unplugged, the computer says that I have about 90 minutes of usage left which is very good for our laptop with a power sucking huge screen.

I wish I could give this router more than 5 stars. Its features are just amazing from the personal cloud storage; (FREE to register your Asus DNS on their network) you can access your files from any PC or any mobile device with the Asus APP. I can stream videos, view pictures and documents the upload feature I was told by an Asus Rep. that they are working on it so you can upload from your phone to your personal cloud storage, for those of you that have set up in the past access to your home routers you have had to set up port forwarding Asus takes care of all of that for you. I know the price of it is a lot more than your Netgear or Linksys routers but trust me you will not be disappointed. Another reason I had chosen this router was because of the external antennas I have a 2 bedroom house and with my Linksys router there would be rooms where I wouldn’t get a signal or would be lower or just randomly disconnect with the Asus router I have get coverage even across the road to my neighbors house about 60 ft away. Obviously this is not a cheap router but I can say I would recommend it to my tech friends and even to the non computer friendly people out there (set up is a breeze).

I give it 5 stars because it does what it says to protect my screen and does not affect my visibility.  Just like having no screen protector at all.  My 3 year old son already gave it test thinking it works like an ipad so after eating some sticky things touching the macbook after i can just wipe it away and i have my screen protected so for this i am happy with this product.  I have not tried any other Macbook screen protector so i cannot compare it but i can recommend this product if you want to protect your investment.  Fits well too and very easy to install.
I could wax poetic and write an ode to this product, but seriously, the headline says it all. Buy with confidence and go in peace.
The replacement battery packs and charger for he Canon HF worked great just as I expected they would.  No problems.
summary: Replacement Battery Packs for Canon HF's

reviewText: i decided to get my four year old twins Asus Memopads instead of the baby type pads that are overpriced but breakproof.  I didn't want to buy a gizmo that would last only a year which was limited in design whereas the android tabs have a ton of kid stuff as well as something that they could grow into.  The problem is that my twins would make mincemeat of new tabs like they did my iphone and ipad. But I found this case that had the same ruggedness as the leaptabs in terms of protection.  The true test came one week after xmas as my son who is like a zombie on these tabs decided to take a plunge on the sidewalk while walking and tabbing at the same time.  Tablet took a dive and hit the ground hard but absolutely zero damage.  Not a scratch.  It practically bounced off the sidewalk.  My son was a little bit more scratched up but the tab survived.  Only criticism is I wish they could make these waterproof or at least come with a protective covering over the glass.  The only issue with that is that the touch sensitivity on the androids is not as good as the ipads so that might not work out so great.  Nonetheless, if  you are looking to get your kids a tablet but don't want to waste money on the kiddie products but need protection, this is a great case.  I highly recommend it.
Bought the first unit and installed it in the kitchen with no problems.  Recently purchased a second one for bedroom use.  Simple and no transformer to play around with.

Pros and cons for NR-401US below.  I bought this for 22 dollars and expected some issues.  My last one required you to have the KVM active on the computer you wanted to start up from the very beginning of the power-up until the machine had been fully loaded.  This one does not require that.Three USB plugs on the KVM make things easy to have a couple of mice.  The extra USB(s) is actually useful for using the KVM as a jump drive hub.  The neat thing is the USB becomes shared and is available to which ever computer is active on the KVM.  I was surprised.  I gave it 4 stars because it acted up one time (Details to solve below).  The button on the KVM jumps around to a port that is not the next consecutive one some times instead of always going to the next port (1 to 2 to 3, etc), but the light is pretty visible and you can keep track of which computer is which, right?Pros:-Cheap and comes with all four cables (I am surprised it is so cheap)-You don't have to be on the active computer with the KVM when you boot up a computer for the mouse to work (USB is wonderful)-4 ports-3 USB ports, which you can use with jump drives to share and don't have to pull out the drive and put in another computerCons:-Couldn't figure out any hot keys to switch ports (I tried all four major ones, no luck) so you need to keep it available-Button to switch computer jumps ports some times.  It means you have to look at the light once every 4 times or so keep it visible-One issue with it in 5 months-Keyboard and mouse can take ~1 second to be recognized, not long but noticable if you are doing a lot of switching-USB 1.1 on the jump drive transfer rate (not good enough for a 1TB external disk although it works)Result:Much cheaper then the big boys like IOGEAR, I would buy it again.To solve the issue for NR-401US,Description:I plugged in a new laptop, and the new laptop didn't recognize the keyboard USB driver.  Make a note of this warning and see below how to fix it.  This caused the keyboard to quit working on all computers through the KVM. Bummer.  There is no help using google search to solve the problem.Solution:I unplugged all the USB plugs on the KVM.  Left it like this for 2 minutes (more than enough to fix).  Still not working.  I plugged in the USB ports on all the computers but the new one, and left the new laptop unplugged.  I booted up the computer on port 1, the mouse and keyboard worked.  I did the same on computer 3, no problem.  I didn't bother with port 2 and plugged in the new computer display and USB.  I then booted up the new laptop and no problem, it worked.Maybe the problem was I started to boot up a new computer without plugging in the display first, as I was so used to booting up computers with them not being active.  I haven't had any other problems, as I have run out of computers (I have 4 desktops, and have had 3 laptops on at different times, this was the only issue ever).

This cover works very nice and I was especially satisfied given the price. I had looked at ordering the super cheap ones but they ship via a slow boat from china. There are much more expensive ones but this one fit the bill perfectly.I've been using it for about a month now and it stays in place quite well. Every now and then I have to move it back in place mostly at the edges but for the most part I like it. What's nice is when it gets dirty I will just wash it or just pick up a new one!!
summary: Works as advertised and a nice price

reviewText: I read that this gadget was heavy, but I didn't believe it. It's made of plastic and aluminum, how heavy can it be? Well it weighs in at almost 15 ounces! At 8" long and 4-1/2" wide, it's built like a battleship.Try and use this on a smaller telescope and you'll have quite a balancing chore to perform. It appears to be sized for an older generation of much larger cameras.One good thing, the little L-shaped foot at the bottom is threaded like a camera, so if your camera and scope are light enough, just clamp them both to this behemoth and screw the adapter itself to the tripod.If this were half the size and half the weight, it would be a winner. As it is, I can't imagine how I'll use it.

Good power supply with ideal wattage for a budget build. I'm sure it could handle a low/mid range gaming setup fine too. I installed one for another person whom had a bad hard drive and it's been going great for almost a year now.
summary: Good power supply for budget builds.

reviewText: Nothing really special to write about this cable. It appears to be put together pretty decently. The only thing negative I can say about this cable is that since it's wrapped in cloth, I suppose there's a great chance it might snag if you happen to be dragging it behind walls or any place else where there might be an object with a sharp edge for it to catch on. Also, the connector is a bit wider then most others. So if where ever you are plugging it in is a tight fit you might want to skip this. I had no problem plugging it into my router though.Other then those issues, this cable looks pretty nice. It certainly looks nicer then your standard rubber/plastic wrapped ethernet cable.
summary: Looks nice, but may not be as practical as standard cable

reviewText: Awesome!  I love having this DIVX player, and its sleek look is great!  I don't know much about the technical things on this player like some of the other reviews, but the only bad thing I can say about this player is that from hitting the 'power' button and then being able to load a disc takes a moment longer than my old dvd player, where I could just hit 'open' and the whole system would turn on.  But since this plays the DIVX movies I really don't care.

Yeah, it's just an iPod cable. But it is one of the coolest cables ever! The ends are nice and sleek, the cable is thin and the length is perfect, coming in at around two feet. I am using it in my car to connect the iPod to the head unit. It is much nicer looking than the OEM ones and the length makes it less messy looking too.

Microsoft always tries to extend its platforms to other devices, this is one example... they give the device more processing power and ram... only to be wasted in the C# runtime... for the benefit of whom? Microsoft's .Net platform, only...If you want an open environment with an open runtime for programming, get a Raspberry Pi with Linux and the OpenJDK Java VM, where you can run a number of languages including JRuby, Jython, xRuby, NetRexx, and more...

Overall while I like this case because of the hand strap and the lightweighness of it, however the workmanship leaves  a bit to be desired.  The edges are not the same quality as the nook hd case. When they were making it the finishing around the edges is roughshod and uneven. On the nook case it is very even and the outside covering completely covers over the edges whereas this case it does not.  The lip when you close the case does not go over the bottom edge, so while it does close it doesn't completely close.I do have to say that despite the shoddy finish workmanship, this is a nice case which doesn't add much weight overall. I love the hand strap cases. The only thing I would add to this case would be the second strap to hold the cover in place when it is turned back in the reading position.  That second strap is nicer than putting a piece of velcro on it.In the end I have given this a 4 star because it is a nice case overall.

reviewText: I've had the Garmin 60CS for 4 months now. I use it with a mounting bracket on my Bike and also use it in my car. I will be getting the car kit and additional map software for it when I go RVing with the in-laws this summer. My job is in sports, fitness, and recreation and I find a lot of uses for this device. When I map out road races participants are always impressed at the amount of information I can give them concerning courses including elevation gains / profiles and very precise measurements. So getting the devices has paid off big time for me when it comes to work. Personally I also use the device a lot because I normally mount it to my bike when I ride to work and am out and about. The GPS gives me more information that any car dashboard could offer. The only drawback for me is the fact that I live in a foreign country (Asia) and Garmin does not make any maps for where I live. Even so there are ways around it (creative third party vendors). Even still it's hard to get maps if you are outside of US or Europe. Bottom line:1. Good Reception2. Feels good in your hand3. Feature rich (provides a lot more information than I use it for i.e. marine, aviation / parachuting, hunting, fishing, etc.)4. Lots of accessoriesGarmin has a good reputation when it comes to producing a quality product. Fortunately I have yet to deal with their customer service department. From previous reviews it looks like it can be frustrating.All the good things you see in the reviews are accurate. I shopped around a while before making a choice and although Garmin is a little on the pricey side they do offer a quality piece of equipment and there are a lot of maps (if you live in the right area and at a price) for you to choose from.I would have probably given it 5 stars if Garmin made maps for my area.

This is a wonderful and cost effective little power supply! I purchased this because of the price and replaced my junky power supply in my low power PC. Previously the PC at Idle was using 42watts, switching to this green power supply which is much more efficient has dropped the idle wattage down to 32/33watts! Doesn't come with a power cord, but this is no problem for me as I had many extra. The color is different, it's a dark green, similar to an olive drab we had in the Marine Corps. I also love how absolutely quiet this thing is! And as for the high pitch noise some users have reported on, that was for the first version of this power supply, this one is the D version which seems to have eliminated that issue. The cable lengths are also great too, they reach everywhere just fine in my larger PC case.I'll add additional pictures on the item here on Amazon to see what it looks like installed. So far I love it!
I got this card after the one I had crashed. I haven't had a problem at all with this one. Very nice card for the price!

There are any reasons why I love this bluetooth keyboard.  First, the design of this keyboard has a "soft rubbery feel."  It is smooth to the touch and it does not add much weight to the overall feel of the keyboard and iPad together.  Once you have placed your iPad into the "holder," the entire unit is set up to mimic a "mini notebook," and the case allows the iPad to turn while in the case so that you can work with the iPad horizontally or vertically.  But the most impressive part of this "mini notebook look" is that the screen, which holds the iPad in place, actually detaches from the keyboard and the screen can stand alone and can be set anywhere that is within the range of the keyboard.  The right shift key is placed a little further than usual, but it will take your finger a lil while to adjust, but I find that it is not a major annoyance. Also, I was able to use my mini portable speaker by Sharkk and I could control it's functions through the keyboard without having to move my fingers from the keyboard to touch the speaker device . Last, but not least, when the iPad closes the "sleep/wake" function kicks in, which is a great for this case........and I almost forgot.  The iPad can detach itself completely from the keyboard and the "monitor stand.  Yes, that's right, just squeeze the back two locks and off she comes, this feature is great for when you just wan to read, without all the extra peripheral device attached to it.  This  keyboard/case  will allow you to do it all,,
summary: All in one "mini notebook look alike case" for iPad

reviewText: First the good ...These are probably the most comfortable 3D glasses I've ever worn.  Admittedly, it's a bit like saying "That's the most enjoyable injection the doctor has ever given me", but these are extremely comfortable.  The clarity and lifelike nature of the 3D images is intoxicating, particularly with Tron Legacy and Mortal Kombat (admittedly, we're not dealing with a deep bench here in terms of content, so hopefully there will be more stuff on the way).Funtionally, pairing them with the TV was effortless (I think my bluetooth mouse was more work) and they are completely automated after that...the TV knows when you are watching 3D-enabled content and wearing the glasses...if you take them off to set them down and stroll in the other room to get a glass of water, it even seems to sense this and put the glasses to sleep and disengage the 3D display.  It's pretty cool if you ask me.We have tried roughly half of the 3D stuff we could get our mits on, video games, blu ray, and VOD/PPV and free stuff via DirecTV.  It looks great (better in my home than in any demo kiosk I've seen anywhere, actually).  It somehow makes the image not just come *out* of the TV, but (as it should) presents the impression that the TV is many times deeper, and that you are actually peering INTO a 3D world, rather than simply watching it bulge out nearer to your face from the screen.  Given the current state of technology and the price point of these, I think I would give these 5 stars.However, I ding two stars as I bought these SPECIFICALLY because to my knowledge no other model on the market allows for my prescription to be installed into the lenses.  Though comfortable, they are not particularly glasses-friendly.  They don't sit properly on my face and tend to skew away from the nose unevenly when I have my regular glasses on underneath, making the picture a bit contorted (I don't think this has anything to do with the 3d glasses themselves per se, but rather just how they sort of fit snugly and therefore are fighting with my regular glasses for pole position on my face).  They say "prescription ready"--and that's about all the website says.  Registering them was no help ... in fact, after registering them, the first question someone else on Samsung's website had posted was "How do I order prescription lenses for these?" and it had 0 responses.The documenation says to check the Samsung website (Wow ... I mean really!).  I was unable to send an e-mail as their support requests/contact interfaces are all forms-based, and these glasses (much like my new TV) are not available from the drop downs yet ... at least not for support.  I called Samsung and they told me to take them to an optometrist.  I contacted three optometrists, and none could do this for me (only one knew what active shutter glasses even were) and suggested I contact the manufacturer (yea, well...).  I went to Best Buy and they hadn't even heard of the prescription ready option yet.  I called Samsung back and they repeated what their screens must have been saying, "take the glases to an optometrist."  When I explained the optometrist was unable to help they said they couldn't help me beyond that--no means of escalation or direct contact with Samsung.As of May, 2011, this is still not just a newer technology, but this is a very new product and the only one available (to my knowledge) boasting a prescription-ready lense.  I am imagining that I will have to send these in to Samsung (or a delegated partner) at some point, pay an additional fee, wait a period of time, and then have them shipped back.  I just wish someone could acknlowledge that this is even a possibility.  By the time all that happens, I'll have a new presciption...Until then ... three stars for you!**UPDATE MAY 23, 2011**I finally reached Samsung on a different troubleshooting line, and they put me on hold for about ten minutes then suggested I go to a Hoya Vision website ... I don't think I can put links in here but will try ... effectively, Samsung has partnered with Hoya Vision to provide lenses for these units, and only certain optometrists are set up for this branded style/type of lens creation.  So far, I have been waiting 4 days for a response from one of the local Hoya shops I called.  They know what the technology is, but have never heard of 3D glasses taking prescription lenses, and so also do not know how it will be done or how much it will cost me.Go to the Hoya Vision website, then click "FIND A HOYA EXPERT" in order to find one locally.  Here is the link (if it works):[...]**UPDATE MAY 27, 2011**So I contacted a local Hoya dealer, and they didn't know what I was talking about.  They said they would call me back but didn't, so I called them back after a few days and they said I was supposed to have heard back from a Hoya rep (though I had not).  They said they would call him again.  A day later I got a call from the Hoya rep, explaining how crazy things have been lately (yadda yadda) but that he would be getting back to me with pricing and implementation information--though oddly he asked me about the glasses--are they active shutter?  Or passive/polarized (always troubling to have to fill in product reps on the product they represent).  I told him these are active shutter/LCD glasses and he said he would call me back shortly.  That was earlier this week, and it's now friday.Still no word ... though I must say, the fact that these are advertised as "prescription ready" when they are actually "clip on ready" makes me contemplate calling foul--my face is prescrption ready, then too.  I think I may file some complaints about false advertsising.  This claim led me to spend thousands on a product that does not deliver what it purports to do.  The fact that I am otherwise satisfied with the product itself does not excuse the fact that misleading advertising was used to sell it to me--and certainly does not change the fact that the key feature I was intrigued by may be a false claim.  However, as I still (a week later) have received no definitive information on how this is done, I still am not sure if I have been duped or not.**UPDATE JUNE 8, 2011**Though I did hear from a Hoya product/field rep over a week ago, and he was working on this, I still have not heard back.  I contacted the area dealer again and they had my paperwork right there--they are contacting the rep again for me.  Still no way to know how to get the Rx into the lens.  Signs keep indicating it won't be "into" the lens--but clipped or adhered onto it.  If this had been more clearly laid out beforehand, I probably wouldn't have bought these or the Samsung TV in the first place.  I'm considering filing some complaints since the product is making claims no one can keep--and it's set me back over $3,000 at this point.

reviewText: In my area, there is hardly any clear frequencies to tune in to. The clearest frequency I could find was 99.5. After tinkering with the volume on my Zune, the sound quality improved with less static, but it's still noticeable. Although not as great as cd audio, I'm willing to sacrifice sound quality in order to play over 2000 songs. It's alot more convenient than burning 100+ CDs. I like the auto-off feature. So far, it hasn't shut off during playback as some have reported. The preset feature is also handy as I don't have to frequency surf every time. The only con I can think of is it uses the 20v cigarette lighter. A bluetooth version of this would be awesome.
